bibl.title: Letter from H.C. Fisher to Henry Rose Carter, April 1, 1919

div1.p: Fisher sends Carter a copy of Carter's 1907 report on pneumonia in the Panama Canal Zone.

div1.head: Letter from H.C. Fisher to Henry Rose Carter, April 1, 1919
div1.opener:
Miscel-
Pneumonia Report
C-Z /17
THE PANAMA CANAL
CANAL ZONE
HEALTH DEPARTMENT
Balboa Heights,
April 1, 1919
Dr. H. R. Carter,
Assistant Surgeon General, U. S. P. H. S.,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
In accordance with your request of March 15, 1919, I take
pleasure in sending you herewith copy of your report of August 28, 1907,
on the prevalence of pneumonia on the Canal Zone, accompanied by various
tables. With your report was also submitted a list showing description
of various laborers houses in Pedro Miguel, Paraiso, and Gorgona--showing
number of bunks, number of occupants, number of doors, windows, etc. It
is hardly thought that you desire a copy of this, but it will be furnished
you if you desire it.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, H c Fisher
Chief Health Officer. Enc:
